verses.text: And \add when\add* king Arad the Canaanite , which dwelt in the south , heard tell that Israel came by the way of the spies ; then he fought against Israel , and took \add some\add* of them prisoners.
And Israel vowed a vow unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and said , If thou wilt indeed deliver this people into my hand , then I will utterly destroy their cities.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hearkened to the voice of Israel , and delivered up the Canaanites ; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities : and he called the name of the place Hormah.\f + \fr 21.3 \ft Hormah: that is, Utter destruction\f* \p

¶ And they journeyed from mount Hor by the way of the Red sea , to compass the land of Edom : and the soul of the people was much discouraged because of the way.\f + \fr 21.4 \ft discouraged: or, grieved: Heb. shortened\f*

And the people spake against God , and against Moses , Wherefore have ye brought us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness ? for \add there is\add* no bread , neither \add is there any\add* water ; and our soul loatheth this light bread.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* sent fiery serpents among the people , and they bit the people ; and much people of Israel died. \p

¶ Therefore the people came to Moses , and said , We have sinned , for we have spoken against the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and against thee; pray unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that he take away the serpents from us. And Moses prayed for the people.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Make thee a fiery serpent , and set it upon a pole : and it shall come to pass, that every one that is bitten , when he looketh upon it, shall live.
And Moses made a serpent of brass , and put it upon a pole , and it came to pass, that if a serpent had bitten any man , when he beheld the serpent of brass , he lived. \p
¶ And the children of Israel set forward , and pitched in Oboth.
And they journeyed from Oboth , and pitched at Ije-abarim , in the wilderness which \add is\add* before Moab , toward the sunrising.\f + \fr 21.11 \ft Ije-abarim: or, heaps of Abarim\f* \p
¶ From thence they removed , and pitched in the valley of Zared.

From thence they removed , and pitched on the other side of Arnon , which \add is\add* in the wilderness that cometh out of the coasts of the Amorites : for Arnon \add is\add* the border of Moab , between Moab and the Amorites.
Wherefore it is said in the book of the wars of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, What he did in the Red sea , and in the brooks of Arnon ,\f + \fr 21.14 \ft What…: or, Vaheb in Suphah\f*
And at the stream of the brooks that goeth down to the dwelling of Ar , and lieth upon the border of Moab.\f + \fr 21.15 \ft lieth: Heb. leaneth\f*
And from thence \add they went\add* to Beer : that \add is\add* the well whereof the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , Gather the people together , and I will give them water. \p
¶ Then Israel sang this song , Spring up , O well ; sing ye unto it:\f + \fr 21.17 \ft Spring…: Heb. Ascend\f*\f + \fr 21.17 \ft sing: or, answer\f*
The princes digged the well , the nobles of the people digged it, by \add the direction of\add* the lawgiver , with their staves. And from the wilderness \add they went\add* to Mattanah :
And from Mattanah to Nahaliel : and from Nahaliel to Bamoth :

And from Bamoth \add in\add* the valley , that \add is\add* in the country of Moab , to the top of Pisgah , which looketh toward Jeshimon.\f + \fr 21.20 \ft country: Heb. field\f*\f + \fr 21.20 \ft Pisgah: or, the hill\f*\f + \fr 21.20 \ft Jeshimon: or, the wilderness\f* \p
¶ And Israel sent messengers unto Sihon king of the Amorites , saying ,

Let me pass through thy land : we will not turn into the fields , or into the vineyards ; we will not drink \add of\add* the waters of the well : \add but\add* we will go along by the king’s \add high\add* way , until we be past thy borders.

And Sihon would not suffer Israel to pass through his border : but Sihon gathered all his people together , and went out against Israel into the wilderness : and he came to Jahaz , and fought against Israel.
And Israel smote him with the edge of the sword , and possessed his land from Arnon unto Jabbok , even unto the children of Ammon : for the border of the children of Ammon \add was\add* strong.
And Israel took all these cities : and Israel dwelt in all the cities of the Amorites , in Heshbon , and in all the villages thereof.\f + \fr 21.25 \ft villages: Heb. daughters\f*
For Heshbon \add was\add* the city of Sihon the king of the Amorites , who had fought against the former king of Moab , and taken all his land out of his hand , even unto Arnon.
Wherefore they that speak in proverbs say , Come into Heshbon , let the city of Sihon be built and prepared :
For there is a fire gone out of Heshbon , a flame from the city of Sihon : it hath consumed Ar of Moab , \add and\add* the lords of the high places of Arnon.
Woe to thee, Moab ! thou art undone , O people of Chemosh : he hath given his sons that escaped , and his daughters , into captivity unto Sihon king of the Amorites.
We have shot at them; Heshbon is perished even unto Dibon , and we have laid them waste even unto Nophah , which \add reacheth\add* unto Medeba. \p
¶ Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.
And Moses sent to spy out Jaazer , and they took the villages thereof, and drove out the Amorites that \add were\add* there. \p
¶ And they turned and went up by the way of Bashan : and Og the king of Bashan went out against them, he, and all his people , to the battle at Edrei.

And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Fear him not: for I have delivered him into thy hand , and all his people , and his land ; and thou shalt do to him as thou didst unto Sihon king of the Amorites , which dwelt at Heshbon.
So they smote him, and his sons , and all his people , until there was none left him alive : and they possessed his land.
